Full Paragraph Text: The business environment was again marked by great uncertainty in 2014. Disruptive socio-economic and political change continued to affect growth in many parts of the world. In the emerging markets, economic volatility worsened as growth rates slowed and currencies weakened. In the developed markets, deflationary pressures and soft consumer demand resulted in a continued challenging trading environment. In the face of such uncertainty it was more important than ever to stay the course and remain loyal to our strategy, driving short-term performance while ensuring we made the right decisions to deliver our long-term goals. We took decisive steps to further our ambition to be the world’s recognised leading Nutrition, Health and Wellness company, trusted by all stakeholders, while again delivering financial results in 2014 that outperformed the market.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph describes general economic conditions across emerging and developed markets without identifying specific actors or explicit causal relationships between different spatial scales. It focuses on a company's strategic response to market conditions rather than cross-scale interactions.
gpt5: Rationale: The text provides broad global market conditions and firm strategy without explicit causal links between actors at different spatial scales.
4o: Rationale: The paragraph discusses economic conditions and company strategy without identifying specific actors or actions at different spatial scales, thus no cross-scale interaction is present.
gemini2.5: Rationale: The paragraph describes global economic conditions and a company's response to them. All mentioned phenomena (e.g., 'growth in many parts of the world', 'emerging markets', 'developed markets', 'economic volatility') operate at the Transnational / Cross-border scale. There are no explicit causal links identified between actors at different spatial scales.

Full Paragraph Text: Through continuous innovation and renovation of our food and beverages portfolio we are able to offer people healthier and tastier choices at every stage of their life, at any time of the day. Science-based innovation enables us to enhance the quality of people’s diets, using our knowledge and our research and development capability to make a positive contribution to society. Wherever you are in the world, we have safe, nutritious products to help you care for yourself and your family. A few years ago, we expanded the boundaries of Nutrition, Health and Wellness with the creation of Nestlé Health Science, motivated by the opportunity to forge a major therapeutic role for nutrition in the management of health. In line with this broadened strategy, in 2014 the Board approved the sale of 48.5 million L’Oréal shares to L’Oréal for cancellation. Part of the proceeds were used for the acquisition of the 50% stake in our joint venture Galderma from L’Oréal, bringing our ownership of Galderma to 100%. Galderma formed the foundation of a new Nestlé subsidiary, Nestlé Skin Health. Its goal is to be recognised as the leading company in skin health, offering science-based solutions to protect, nourish and enhance skin, and where needed to treat, correct and restore damaged skin over the course of people’s lives. Nestlé Skin Health provides prescription drugs, self-medication, therapeutic skin care and aesthetic and corrective medicine, allowing us to compete in the growing and promising multi-billion global skincare market. Nestlé Skin Health was further strengthened by the acquisition of the full rights to commercialise several key aesthetic dermatology products in the United States and Canada.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph describes Nestlé's corporate strategy and business operations but lacks explicit causal relationships between actors at different spatial scales. While it mentions global presence and specific regional acquisitions, these are descriptive statements about corporate activities rather than cross-scale interactions where one spatial level causally influences another.
gpt5: Scale Explanations: Transnational / Cross-border: Nestlé operates in the global skincare market and across countries.; National: Rights to commercialise products in the United States and Canada are specified.
gpt5: Summary: [Transnational / Cross-border, National] A global firm acquired rights enabling product commercialization within US and Canadian national markets.
gpt5: Rationale: The text explicitly ties a transnational firm's acquisition to commercialization rights in specific countries. No other explicit cross-scale causal links are described.
4o: Links: Transnational / Cross-border -> National | National -> Local / Site-specific
4o: Final Link: Transnational / Cross-border -> National, National -> Local / Site-specific
4o: Summary: [Transnational / Cross-border, National, Local / Site-specific] Nestlé's global strategy impacts national markets, which in turn affect local operations in the US and Canada.
4o: Rationale: The text describes Nestlé's global strategy affecting national markets, which then influence local operations. The three scales are necessary to capture the full interaction chain from global to local levels.
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Transnational / Cross-border: Nestlé operates 'Wherever you are in the world' and competes in the 'global skincare market'.; National: 'United States and Canada' are specific country-level markets.
gemini2.5: Summary: [Transnational / Cross-border, National] A transnational company acquired commercial rights for products in specific national markets.
gemini2.5: Rationale: The paragraph explicitly states Nestlé Skin Health, a transnational entity, acquired commercial rights for products in the United States and Canada, which are national scales. This demonstrates a direct causal influence from a transnational actor on national markets.

Full Paragraph Text: These developments ensure that, building on the strong foundations of our food and beverages business and guided increasingly by science, we can further expand our portfolio to provide promising platforms for future growth in line with our strategy of Nutrition, Health and Wellness. At the same time, we continue the drive to ensure our company is organised efficiently and effectively to deliver continuous profitable growth over the long term. With this objective in mind we made some key decisions, adapting our organisational structure to better prepare ourselves today to meet the challenges of tomorrow.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph discusses corporate strategy, organizational structure, and business portfolio expansion without identifying any specific spatial actors or geographical scales. All content relates to internal company operations and strategic planning without explicit spatial or cross-scale causal relationships.
gpt5: Rationale: No geographic actors or scales are mentioned; the text discusses internal corporate strategy without cross-scale causal influence.
4o: Rationale: The paragraph discusses internal company strategies without mentioning any specific geographical scales or cross-scale interactions.
gemini2.5: Rationale: The paragraph discusses internal company strategy, portfolio expansion, and organizational structure. It does not identify any concrete actors or actions with explicit geographical relevance that interact across different spatial scales.

Full Paragraph Text: While our company continues to benefit from its decentralised structure, allowing key decisions to be made as close as possible to consumers, there is still an important opportunity to better leverage our scale. That is why in 2014 we set up Nestlé Business Excellence at Executive Board Level, combining GLOBE (Nestlé’s Global Business Excellence function) with Nestlé Business Services (our shared operation for transactional services around the world) and Nestlé Con tinuous Excellence (our continuous improvement and LEAN programme). Through a focus on three areas: Simplifying, Standardising and Sharing, Nestlé Business Excellence will allow us to decrease structural costs and operational expenses, freeing up resources to support growth. This will also allow our markets to keep a sharp focus on generating demand.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph describes internal corporate restructuring and business operations without identifying specific geographical actors or explicit causal relationships between different spatial scales. While it mentions 'markets' and 'around the world,' these are abstract business concepts rather than concrete spatial actors with cross-scale interactions.
gpt5: Links: Transnational / Cross-border -> Local / Site-specific | Transnational / Cross-border -> National
gpt5: Scale Explanations: Transnational / Cross-border: Global Executive Board-level 'Nestlé Business Excellence' and functions 'around the world'.; National: 'Our markets' refers to country-level market units.; Local / Site-specific: 'Decisions ... as close as possible to consumers' indicates local decision-making.
gpt5: Summary: [Transnational / Cross-border, National, Local / Site-specific] Global Nestlé programs let country markets focus on demand and enable local, consumer-proximate decision-making.
gpt5: Rationale: Global corporate functions are stated to enable both local decision-making and country market focus, forming two explicit top-down links. We keep three scales to reflect global-to-national and global-to-local effects.
4o: Rationale: The paragraph describes internal company strategies without explicit cross-scale geographical interactions.

gemini2.5: Final Link: Transnational / Cross-border -> Local / Site-specific, Transnational / Cross-border -> National

gemini2.5: Summary: [Transnational / Cross-border, Local / Site-specific, National] Nestlé's transnational structure enables local decision-making, and its global business excellence initiatives empower national markets.
gemini2.5: Rationale: The paragraph explicitly details how Nestlé's transnational structure influences local decision-making and how its global business excellence function impacts national market operations. These two distinct causal pathways demonstrate cross-scale interactions involving three clearly defined scales.

Full Paragraph Text: We have integrated the Maghreb, the Middle East, the North East Africa region, Turkey and Israel into Zone Europe to form Zone EMENA (Europe, Middle East and North Africa). This balances the different consumer dynamics and opportunities in each geography. Additionally it allows a sharper focus in Zone Asia, Oceania and Africa, a fast-growing part

Full Paragraph Text: The new Nestlé Business Excellence function is led by Chris Johnson, the former head of Zone Americas. Zone Americas is now led by Laurent Freixe, the former head of Zone Europe, and the new Zone EMENA by Luis Cantarell, who previously was in charge of Nestlé Nutrition and Nestlé Health Science. The new head of Nestlé Nutrition is Heiko Schipper, who was formerly responsible for our Global Infant Nutrition division. Nestlé Health Science is led by Greg Behar, who joined the company from Boehringer Ingelheim in July. The newly established Nestlé Skin Health is led by Humberto Antunes, former ly the Chief Executive Officer of our joint venture Galderma.

While it mentions geographic zones like Americas and Europe, these are administrative divisions rather than actors with causal influence across spatial scales.

Full Paragraph Text: We further reinforced our business through continued active portfolio management, reviewing the performance of different products in different markets to assess strate gic fit, the extent to which they were accretive against our financial targets, and what investments were necessary to deliver growth. We made choices about where we wanted to invest, where we wanted to improve, and what we wanted to divest. Making such choices enables us to align our resourc es behind our best ideas, products and categories, to deliver sustained financial performance and help us on our journey to recognised Nutrition, Health and Wellness leadership over the short term and the long term.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph discusses corporate portfolio management and business strategy without identifying specific geographical actors or locations. All activities described are internal business operations without explicit spatial scale interactions.
gpt5: Rationale: No explicit geographical actors or cross-scale causal influences are stated; 'different markets' is vague and not tied to a specific scale.
4o: Rationale: The paragraph discusses internal business strategy without explicit cross-scale geographical interactions.

While a causal link exists between the business's decisions and its operations in these markets, the text does not explicitly define the geographical scales of the 'business' or the 'markets' in a way that guarantees a cross-scale interaction. The scales could be the same (e.g., a global company managing global markets, or a local company managing local markets), thus no explicit cross-scale link is present.

Full Paragraph Text: We also announced new investments and research collaborations, which will enhance our ability to deliver sci ence-based solutions to improve the quality of people’s lives. A newly-announced research partnership with the EpiGen consortium will help us to better develop our understanding of the influence of nutrition and genetics at the beginning of life and continue to build our knowledge in this important area. The Nestlé Institute of Health Sciences began a collab oration on a groundbreaking project, which could one day lead to the development of made-to-measure vitamin com binations tailored to individual needs. Our company was founded almost 150 years ago on the product Henri Nestlé invented, farine lactée. It saved the life of a child. Today we continue to invest in science-based innovation to ensure we can answer current and future needs.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph discusses corporate research partnerships and innovation activities but lacks explicit spatial references or geographical actors. While mentioning collaborations and institutes, no specific locations or cross-scale causal relationships are identified.

4o: Rationale: The paragraph describes collaborations and investments without specifying spatial scales or cross-scale interactions.

gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Transnational / Cross-border: Refers to 'We' and 'Our company' (Nestlé), a global entity, and its 'Nestlé Institute of Health Sciences'.; Local / Site-specific: Refers to 'people’s lives' and 'individual needs', representing specific impacts on individuals or local populations.

Full Paragraph Text: It is our fundamental belief that to be successful over time we need to create value for our shareholders while at the same time creating value for society. We call this Creating Shared Value. To prosper we have to take a long-term view, framed in a robust set of principles and values that are based on respect: respect for people, respect for the environment, and respect for the world we live in. What we do and the effects of what we do are highly visible. It is our responsibility to connect with different stakeholders, to show transparency and build trust. We have therefore again in 2014 reported on our social performance and our compliance in our Nestlé in society report, and our progress towards meeting the tough targets we set ourselves.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph discusses corporate philosophy and reporting practices without identifying specific spatial actors or explicit causal relationships between different geographical scales. All statements are abstract principles rather than concrete spatial interactions.
gpt5: Rationale: The paragraph contains corporate values and reporting statements but no explicit causal interactions between actors at different spatial scales.
4o: Rationale: The paragraph discusses abstract principles and values without specifying concrete actors or actions at different spatial scales.
gemini2.5: Rationale: The paragraph describes a company's internal philosophy, values, and reporting practices. It does not explicitly state any causal interactions where an actor at one spatial scale influences or is influenced by an actor at another distinct spatial scale.

Full Paragraph Text: In 2014 we held another successful Creating Shared Value forum, this time at the Nestlé Research Center in Lausanne, co-organised for the first time with a United Nations body, the UN Conference on Trade and Development (UNCTAD). The President of the Swiss Confederation used his address to the event to plead for water to become a self-standing goal of the future global development agenda. At the event we renewed our long-standing partnership with the International Federation of Red Cross and Red Crescent Societies. Since 2006 this collaboration has focused on the improvement of rural communities’ access to clean water and sanitation.
claude4: Links: National -> Transnational / Cross-border | Transnational / Cross-border -> Local / Site-specific
claude4: Final Link: National -> Transnational / Cross-border, Transnational / Cross-border -> Local / Site-specific
claude4: Scale Explanations: Local / Site-specific: Rural communities receiving water and sanitation improvements; National: Swiss Confederation President advocating for water policy; Transnational / Cross-border: UN body (UNCTAD) and global development agenda
claude4: Summary: [National, Transnational / Cross-border, Local / Site-specific] Swiss President advocates for global water goals while international partnership improves rural water access
claude4: Rationale: The Swiss President explicitly advocated to influence global development agenda, and the international partnership explicitly targets rural community improvements. These represent clear cross-scale causal influences.
gpt5: Links: Transnational / Cross-border -> Local / Site-specific | National -> Transnational / Cross-border
gpt5: Scale Explanations: Local / Site-specific: Nestlé Research Center in Lausanne; rural communities’ access.; National: President of the Swiss Confederation (country-level leader).; Transnational / Cross-border: UNCTAD and the International Federation of Red Cross and Red Crescent Societies; global development agenda.
gpt5: Summary: [Local / Site-specific, National, Transnational / Cross-border] IFRC targets rural water access locally; Swiss President seeks to shape the global development agenda.
gpt5: Rationale: Transnational actors (IFRC) act to improve local rural water access, yielding a clear transnational-to-local link. The Swiss President’s plea targets the global agenda, a national-to-transnational link.
4o: Links: National -> Transnational / Cross-border | Transnational / Cross-border -> Local / Site-specific
4o: Final Link: National -> Transnational / Cross-border, Transnational / Cross-border -> Local / Site-specific

4o: Rationale: The President's address at a UNCTAD event shows a national to transnational link. The partnership with the Red Cross impacts local water access, showing a transnational to local link. These are the clearest cross-scale interactions present.

gemini2.5: Final Link: National -> Transnational / Cross-border, Transnational / Cross-border -> Local / Site-specific

Full Paragraph Text: Currently, at the United Nations there are intense discussions about the global development goals for the period after 2015. At the same time, governments and international organ isations are increasingly reliant on the expertise, experience and resources of the private sector to help address some of the world’s most pressing problems. This offers an opportunity for global companies such as Nestlé to make a valu able contribution, in partnership with governments and civil society. We are participating actively in the policy dialogue in areas which will deeply influence our future business, such as food security, nutrition and health, water, sustainability, and human rights.
claude4: Links: Transnational / Cross-border -> National | National -> Local / Site-specific
claude4: Final Link: Transnational / Cross-border -> National, National -> Local / Site-specific

claude4: Summary: [Transnational / Cross-border, National, Local / Site-specific] UN development goals drive government reliance on private sector, creating partnership opportunities for companies like Nestlé.

Each link represents explicit causal influence rather than mere correlation.

4o: Scale Explanations: Transnational / Cross-border: United Nations discussions and global companies like Nestlé.; National: Governments participating in policy dialogue.

4o: Rationale: The text describes how global companies and international organizations engage with national governments in policy dialogue, creating a cross-scale interaction. Only two scales are clearly involved, so no further scales are needed.

Full Paragraph Text: Our success has always been based upon our determination to stay the course and look ahead, to understand the environment in which we operate, to organise ourselves to seize opportunities to deliver profitable growth, now and in the future. Although we are operating in a challenging and turbulent economic environment, we see these as fascinating times, full of opportunities. We continue to commit ourselves to ambitious financial targets. We aim to achieve organic growth of around 5% to 6%, improvements in margins and underlying earnings per share in constant currencies, as well as capital efficiency. There will be years when we exceed our ambition and years where we come close, but this is the line we want to walk over time.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph discusses corporate strategy and financial targets without identifying specific spatial actors or locations. No cross-scale geographical interactions are present as the text focuses on business performance metrics rather than spatially-defined entities influencing each other.
gpt5: Rationale: No concrete actors or places are named, and no explicit causal influence across spatial scales is described.

gemini2.5: Rationale: The paragraph describes a company's internal business strategy and financial goals without mentioning any specific geographical locations, actors at different spatial scales, or causal interactions between them.

Their talent, their creativity, their discipline and entrepreneurship are key to delivering our results. We would also like to thank you, our shareholders, for your investment and your confidence, which have enabled us to deliver good returns for investors over the long term.

Full Paragraph Text: Nutrition, Health and Wellness is a priority for the people who buy our products, for society as a whole and for us as a busi ness. As the world’s leading food and beverage company we have a responsibility to use our knowledge and our research and development capability to make a positive difference to society. We have an important role to play in not only provid ing good nutrition but in helping people understand its value.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph discusses a company's general responsibility and role regarding nutrition without specifying any geographical locations or spatial scales. No concrete actors with spatial attributes or cross-scale causal relationships are identified.
gpt5: Rationale: The paragraph mentions a global company and generic ‘society’ but provides no explicit, geographically defined cross-scale causal link between different spatial actors.
4o: Rationale: The paragraph discusses abstract responsibilities and roles without specifying concrete actors or actions at different spatial scales.
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Transnational / Cross-border: The text refers to 'the world’s leading food and beverage company', indicating a global presence and influence.; Local / Site-specific: The text mentions 'people who buy our products' and 'helping people understand its value', referring to individual consumers at specific locations.
gemini2.5: Summary: [Transnational / Cross-border, Local / Site-specific] The world's leading food and beverage company influences people by providing nutrition and education.
gemini2.5: Rationale: The paragraph explicitly states the 'world’s leading food and beverage company' (Transnational) acts to influence 'people' (Local) through nutrition and education. No other explicit cross-scale causal links were identified in the text.

Full Paragraph Text: Start Healthy Stay Healthy is our interactive, science-based education programme designed to help parents and care givers provide nutritionally and developmentally adequate nutrition in the crucial first 1000 days of life. We support and promote breastfeeding as the best start a baby can have in life. Our educational programmes are targeted at people who are most involved in implementing good practices during this important early period in a child’s development. We help to guide parents and caregivers to raise healthier children and help healthcare professionals have a greater impact on the nutritional aspects of care of future generations.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph describes an educational program's general approach and target audiences without specifying any geographical locations or spatial scales. No actors are mapped to specific spatial contexts, and no cross-scale causal relationships are established.
gpt5: Rationale: No explicit geographic scales or cross-scale causal influences are stated; actors (program, parents, healthcare professionals) lack mappable spatial levels.
4o: Rationale: The paragraph describes an educational program without explicit cross-scale interactions between different geographical actors.
gemini2.5: Rationale: The paragraph describes an education program and its beneficiaries (parents, caregivers, healthcare professionals). While these beneficiaries operate at a 'Local / Site-specific' scale, the spatial scale of the 'Start Healthy Stay Healthy' program itself is not explicitly defined in the text. Without a clear spatial scale for the program, no explicit cross-scale interaction can be identified.

Full Paragraph Text: We continue to reinforce our leadership in the area of chil dren’s nutrition. By the end of 2014 98% of all our products for children met the Nestlé Nutritional Foundation criteria for children. These criteria are based on nutrition science and public health dietary recommendations from bodies such as the World Health Organization and the Institute of Medicine. Our products are evaluated against these criteria using the Nestlé Nutritional Profiling System which determines their nutritional value and whether they achieve Nestlé Nutritional Foundation status.
claude4: Scale Explanations: National: Nestlé as a company operating across countries with corporate-wide product standards; Transnational / Cross-border: World Health Organization and Institute of Medicine providing global dietary recommendations
claude4: Summary: [Transnational / Cross-border, National] Global health organizations' dietary recommendations shape Nestlé's corporate nutrition standards for children's products.
claude4: Rationale: The WHO and Institute of Medicine provide transnational dietary recommendations that Nestlé explicitly uses to establish their corporate nutrition criteria. This creates a clear influence from global health bodies to corporate policy implementation.
gpt5: Scale Explanations: National: The Institute of Medicine provides national (U.S.) dietary recommendations.; Transnational / Cross-border: World Health Organization is global; Nestlé applies company-wide nutrition criteria.
gpt5: Summary: [National, Transnational / Cross-border] Institute of Medicine recommendations explicitly underpin Nestlé’s global nutrition criteria.
gpt5: Rationale: The text states IOM recommendations are the basis for Nestlé’s criteria, linking a national body to a global corporate standard. WHO’s role is same-scale with Nestlé and thus excluded.
4o: Scale Explanations: Local / Site-specific: Nestlé products for children are distributed and consumed in specific places.; Transnational / Cross-border: World Health Organization and Institute of Medicine provide international dietary recommendations.
4o: Summary: [Local / Site-specific, Transnational / Cross-border] WHO and Institute of Medicine recommendations influence Nestlé's local product criteria for children's nutrition.
4o: Rationale: The WHO and Institute of Medicine provide international guidelines that Nestlé uses to evaluate its products locally. No other scales are clearly involved in this interaction.
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: National: The Institute of Medicine is a US-based organization.; Transnational / Cross-border: Nestlé is a multinational corporation, and the World Health Organization is an international body.
gemini2.5: Summary: [National, Transnational / Cross-border] Nestlé's transnational nutritional criteria are influenced by recommendations from the national Institute of Medicine.
gemini2.5: Rationale: The paragraph explicitly states that Nestlé's transnational criteria are based on recommendations from the national Institute of Medicine, establishing a clear causal link between these two distinct spatial scales. Only two scales were necessary to capture this interaction.

Full Paragraph Text: We are carrying out large-scale studies together with lead ing scientists of children’s diet and lifestyles, based on the success of the Nestlé Feeding Infants and Toddlers Study. In addition to dietary intakes and behaviours, our research explores family dynamics around diets and key lifestyle patterns of children while documenting their height and weight. We use this data to support our product reformulation, consumer communication and educational programmes, and we share the results with the wider scientific community, non-governmental organisations and others.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph describes Nestlé's research activities and data usage but lacks explicit spatial actors or cross-scale causal relationships. While the company operates globally, no specific geographical scales or their interactions are mentioned in the text.
gpt5: Scale Explanations: Local / Site-specific: Data on family dynamics, children's diets, behaviours, height and weight.; Transnational / Cross-border: A multinational company ('we') reformulates products and runs programmes; shares with wider scientific community and NGOs.
gpt5: Summary: [Local / Site-specific, Transnational / Cross-border] Local family/child diet and growth data is used by a multinational to reformulate products and design programmes.
gpt5: Rationale: Local-level data from families/children explicitly informs a transnational firm's product and programme decisions. No other scales are explicitly linked causally in the text.
4o: Rationale: The paragraph describes research activities and data sharing but does not explicitly mention any cross-scale causal interactions between actors at different spatial scales.
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Transnational / Cross-border: Nestlé's 'large-scale studies' and sharing with the 'wider scientific community' indicate a multi-country scope.; Local / Site-specific: 'Educational programmes' are typically implemented in specific communities, schools, or facilities.
gemini2.5: Summary: [Transnational / Cross-border, Local / Site-specific] Data from large-scale transnational studies informs and supports local educational programs.
gemini2.5: Rationale: The paragraph describes Nestlé (Transnational) conducting large-scale studies. The data from these studies is explicitly used to support 'educational programmes,' which are typically implemented at a Local / Site-specific level. This establishes a clear causal link between these two distinct spatial scales.

Full Paragraph Text: We ensure global compliance with responsible advertising and marketing standards for children, abiding by external pledges such as the EU Pledge. At the end of 2014, the Ex ecutive Board approved an updated and strengthened Nestlé Marketing Communication to Children Policy, which will come into effect in December 2015. To ensure consistent and effective implementation, detailed internal guidelines have been developed and external stakeholders are encouraged to provide feedback via our Tell us reporting mechanism. We have phased out our marketing communication in schools and reinforced our health and wellness education activities, particularly those that positively impact children’s development and support governments’ goals to increase physical activity.
claude4: Scale Explanations: National: governments' goals to increase physical activity - refers to country-level policy objectives; Transnational / Cross-border: EU Pledge and global compliance standards - multi-country regulatory frameworks
claude4: Summary: [Transnational / Cross-border, National] Global compliance standards influence support for national government physical activity goals
claude4: Rationale: The text shows how transnational regulatory frameworks (EU Pledge, global standards) shape corporate activities that support national government objectives. Only two scales are clearly present with explicit causal connection.
gpt5: Scale Explanations: Local / Site-specific: References to schools and local health and wellness education activities.; National: Mentions 'governments’ goals to increase physical activity.'
gpt5: Summary: [Local / Site-specific, National] Local education activities are stated to support governments’ goals to increase physical activity.
gpt5: Rationale: The text explicitly states local activities support governments’ goals, forming a Local-to-National causal link. Other elements (EU Pledge, corporate policy) lack explicit cross-scale causality.

4o: Final Link: Transnational / Cross-border -> National, National -> Local / Site-specific
4o: Scale Explanations: Local / Site-specific: Marketing communication in schools and health activities.; Transnational / Cross-border: EU Pledge as a multi-country initiative.; National: Support governments' goals to increase physical activity.
4o: Summary: [Transnational / Cross-border, National, Local / Site-specific] EU Pledge influences national policies, which in turn affect local school activities.
4o: Rationale: N/A

gemini2.5: Final Link: Transnational / Cross-border -> Local / Site-specific, Local / Site-specific -> National / Sub-national
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Transnational / Cross-border: Nestlé's 'global compliance' and 'EU Pledge' indicate a transnational scope, with its 'Executive Board' approving a company-wide policy.; Local / Site-specific: 'marketing communication in schools' and 'health and wellness education activities' are actions implemented at specific local sites.; National / Sub-national: 'governments’ goals to increase physical activity' refers to objectives set by national or sub-national governmental bodies.
gemini2.5: Summary: [Transnational / Cross-border, Local / Site-specific, National / Sub-national] Nestlé's transnational policies directly influence local marketing and education activities, which in turn support national government goals.
gemini2.5: Rationale: The paragraph explicitly details how Nestlé's transnational policies lead to changes in local operations (marketing in schools, education activities). Furthermore, these local activities are stated to support national/sub-national government objectives, forming a clear cross-scale causal chain.

Full Paragraph Text: By the end of 2014 the Nestlé Healthy Kids programme was in 73 countries, supporting initiatives which demonstrate how appropriate nutrition and exercise can improve the health of children and their communities. In addition, our own studies in four countries have shown that two thirds of children are insufficiently hydrated when they arrive at school. In 2014 we provided tools and information that schools, parents and caregivers need to ensure children learn about the benefits of healthy hydration.
claude4: Scale Explanations: Transnational / Cross-border: Nestlé programme operating across 73 countries globally; Local / Site-specific: Individual schools receiving tools and information
claude4: Summary: [Transnational / Cross-border, Local / Site-specific] Global Nestlé programme provides nutrition tools directly to individual schools.
claude4: Rationale: The text explicitly states Nestlé's 73-country programme provided tools to schools, creating a clear transnational-to-local link. The four-country studies inform but don't create additional cross-scale interactions.
gpt5: Scale Explanations: Transnational / Cross-border: Nestlé Healthy Kids operated in 73 countries and provided tools/information.; Local / Site-specific: Schools, parents, caregivers, and children’s communities are local actors.
gpt5: Summary: [Transnational / Cross-border, Local / Site-specific] A cross-country Nestlé program supported initiatives and gave tools to schools/parents, directly shaping local child health learning.
gpt5: Rationale: Nestlé’s multi-country program is transnational; schools/communities are local. The text explicitly links transnational actions (support, tools) to local actors’ behavior and outcomes; no other scales are explicitly engaged.
4o: Rationale: The paragraph describes actions at a transnational scale but lacks explicit causal links between different spatial scales.
gemini2.5: Links: Transnational / Cross-border -> Local / Site-specific | Transnational / Cross-border -> Local / Site-specific
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Transnational / Cross-border: Nestlé Healthy Kids programme operates in 73 countries; Nestlé's studies are in four countries, indicating multi-country operations.; Local / Site-specific: Initiatives improve health of children and their communities; children arrive at school; schools, parents and caregivers operate at this level.
gemini2.5: Summary: [Transnational / Cross-border, Local / Site-specific] Nestlé's transnational programs and provision of resources directly influence local initiatives and actors like schools and parents.
gemini2.5: Rationale: The paragraph explicitly details Nestlé's transnational program supporting local initiatives and its global entity providing tools to local actors. These actions demonstrate clear causal links from the transnational scale to the local scale.

Full Paragraph Text: United for Healthier Kids is a platform, created by Nestlé in 2014, where society can engage and collaborate to find ways to improve the health and wellness of children, from conception to the age of 12 years. In Mexico, a TV series was launched which supports and encourages five families looking to change their eating and lifestyle habits over six months. The platform has also been launched in the Philippines.
claude4: Scale Explanations: Transnational / Cross-border: Nestlé's United for Healthier Kids platform operates across multiple countries; National: TV series launched specifically in Mexico and platform launched in the Philippines
claude4: Summary: [Transnational / Cross-border, National] Nestlé's global platform launches country-specific health programs in Mexico and Philippines.
claude4: Rationale: The link shows Nestlé's transnational platform explicitly creating national-level implementations. Only two scales are clearly present in the text.

gpt5: Scale Explanations: Transnational / Cross-border: United for Healthier Kids platform created by Nestlé spans multiple countries.; National: Actions specified in Mexico and the Philippines.; Local / Site-specific: Five families in Mexico targeted by the TV series.
gpt5: Summary: [Transnational / Cross-border, National, Local / Site-specific] A country-level TV series in Mexico supports five families, and a cross-border platform is launched at the national level in the Philippines.
gpt5: Rationale: The Mexico TV series explicitly supports local families (national to local). The platform’s launch in the Philippines shows a transnational initiative implemented at a national scale; no explicit chain links both cases.

gemini2.5: Final Link: Transnational / Cross-border -> National, National -> Local / Site-specific
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Local / Site-specific: Refers to 'five families' changing their habits.; National: Refers to 'Mexico' and 'Philippines' as countries, and a 'TV series' within Mexico.; Transnational / Cross-border: Refers to the 'United for Healthier Kids' platform, created by Nestlé, launched in multiple countries.

Full Paragraph Text: Through innovation and renovation we continue to make our products tastier and healthier. In line with the recommendations from public health authorities, we are reducing the amount of salt, sugar and saturated fats in our products as part of our contribution towards the fight against non-communicable diseases in society. Our reduction targets are in cluded in our public nutrition commitments (detailed in the Nestlé in society report) so our progress can be measured. We are also ensuring that whole grains are the primary ingredient in our breakfast cereals for children and teenagers.
claude4: Scale Explanations: Local / Site-specific: Company's specific product reformulation activities and manufacturing processes; National: Public health authorities providing recommendations that guide company actions
claude4: Summary: [National, Local / Site-specific] Public health authorities guide company product reformulation efforts
claude4: Rationale: National public health authorities explicitly provide recommendations that causally influence the company's local product development activities. The company states they are acting 'in line with' these recommendations, showing clear cross-scale influence.
gpt5: Rationale: The text cites “public health authorities” influencing company actions, but provides no explicit geographic scale (local, regional, national, or transnational) for either actor.
4o: Rationale: The paragraph describes internal company actions and commitments without explicit cross-scale interactions involving different spatial actors.
gemini2.5: Rationale: The paragraph describes a transnational company's internal actions and commitments. While 'public health authorities' are mentioned as an influence, their specific spatial scale is not explicitly defined, preventing the identification of a clear cross-scale actor. 'Society' is too abstract to be mapped to a specific spatial scale actor.

Full Paragraph Text: We want to help people who buy our products to make informed decisions by giving them better nutritional information on our product labels. We are enhancing our portion guidance and have committed to print GDAs (Guideline Daily Amounts) on the front of all relevant packaging. These make it easier for people to see how much salt, sugar or fat is in the product, and how the amounts compare to reference daily guidelines. Nestlé Portion Guidance is a voluntary initiative
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph describes Nestlé's product labeling initiative but contains no explicit spatial actors or geographical references. While the company operates across scales, no specific locations, regions, or cross-scale causal relationships are mentioned in this text.
gpt5: Rationale: The text describes a company's voluntary labeling initiative and its effects on consumers but does not specify any cross-scale actors (e.g., national regulators) or explicit causal interactions across scales.
4o: Rationale: The paragraph discusses a company initiative without explicit cross-scale interactions involving different geographical actors.
gemini2.5: Links: Transnational / Cross-border -> Local / Site-specific | Transnational / Cross-border -> Local / Site-specific
gemini2.5: Final Link: Transnational / Cross-border -> Local / Site-specific, Transnational / Cross-border -> Local / Site-specific
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Transnational / Cross-border: Refers to 'We' (Nestlé), a global company implementing a 'voluntary initiative' across multiple countries.; Local / Site-specific: Refers to 'product labels,' 'packaging,' and 'people who buy our products' (consumers) at specific points of sale/consumption.
gemini2.5: Summary: [Transnational / Cross-border, Local / Site-specific] Nestlé's transnational initiative to provide nutritional information on product labels directly influences local packaging and consumer decision-making.
gemini2.5: Rationale: The paragraph explicitly states Nestlé's (Transnational) commitment to print GDAs on packaging (Local) and its goal to help local consumers make informed decisions. These represent direct causal influences from a global corporate policy to local implementation and impact.

Full Paragraph Text: that bridges the gap between dietary recommendations and more user-friendly information to promote the right portion size. It is designed to help reframe portion norms, particularly in energy dense categories where habitual servings have increased over time.

Full Paragraph Text: In parts of the world where people find it difficult to get essential vitamins and minerals in their daily diets, we fortify foods to help them and their families stay healthy. We are on track to deliver our commitment of 200 billion servings of micronutrient fortified foods and beverages annually around the world by next year. In 2014 we continued to extend the reach of our microfortification programmes, focusing on categories for children and women of child-bearing age, such as fortified infant cereals and growing-up milks.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph describes a global food fortification program but lacks explicit causal interactions between different spatial scales. While it mentions delivery 'around the world' and program extension, no specific actors at different scales are shown influencing each other.
gpt5: Links: Local / Site-specific -> Transnational / Cross-border | Transnational / Cross-border -> Local / Site-specific

gpt5: Rationale: The text explicitly ties local nutritional shortfalls to a global company’s fortification actions and states those actions aim to help local families. Only Local and Transnational scales are needed and evidenced.
4o: Rationale: The paragraph describes a global initiative but lacks explicit cross-scale causal interactions between different spatial scales.

gemini2.5: Summary: [Transnational / Cross-border, Local / Site-specific] A transnational entity fortifies foods globally, directly impacting the health of local populations.
gemini2.5: Rationale: The text explicitly links the transnational action of food fortification by 'we' to the health benefits for 'people and their families' at the local scale. No other explicit cross-scale interactions are present.

Full Paragraph Text: Our company was founded almost 150 years ago on the product Henri Nestlé invented, farine lactée. It saved the life of a child. Nestlé’s success has been built on innovation, which will continue to drive performance and deliver profitable growth in the years ahead. Across our portfolio, innovation reinforced our growth platforms in 2014.

Full Paragraph Text: Increasingly, science-based innovation enables us to improve the quality of people’s lives with new ideas, products and solutions. We introduced a new lactose free infant formula with probiotic L. reuteri that helps infants recover from diarrhoea. We rolled out new organic fruit purée pouches for infants, combining good nutrition with convenience.

Therefore, no explicit cross-scale interaction can be identified.

At the same time scientific understanding of health, disease and the potential of nutrition is growing.

4o: Rationale: The paragraph discusses global trends and estimates without identifying specific actors or explicit cross-scale causal interactions.

Full Paragraph Text: Nestlé Health Science aims to champion the role of nutritional therapies that have proven clinical and health economic value, and improve the quality of people’s lives. The company focuses on three areas: Consumer Care, which aims to address specific health conditions with an emphasis on enhancing ‘healthy ageing’; Medical Nutrition, which supplies hospitals and other healthcare facilities; and Novel Therapeutic nutrition, which works on new nutritional therapies (including pre scribed medicines) for specific diseases and conditions that would be administered by a health professional.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph describes Nestlé Health Science's business strategy and product divisions without specifying any geographical locations or spatial scales. No actors are mapped to specific places, regions, or countries, and no cross-scale causal relationships are established.
gpt5: Rationale: The text mentions a company and hospitals (local sites) but provides no explicit geographical scale for the company, so no cross-scale causal link can be grounded from the paragraph.

While the latter are clearly Local / Site-specific, the spatial scale of 'Nestlé Health Science' itself is not explicitly defined within the text, making it impossible to identify a cross-scale interaction.

Full Paragraph Text: Nestlé’s Jian Xin Double Care, a specially designed milk to enhance heart and bone health for middle-aged and senior adults, was launched in China in December 2013. Full Paragraph Text: In 2014, we transformed a dairy factory in Mexico into the company’s first ‘zero water’ manufacturing site in the world. Cow’s milk is 88% water, so by extracting some of it to use in the factory’s systems, we are saving enough water to meet the average daily consumption of 6400 people in the surrounding area.
claude4: Scale Explanations: Local / Site-specific: The dairy factory in Mexico and surrounding area with 6400 people represent specific local places; Transnational / Cross-border: The company's global operations implementing world's first 'zero water' manufacturing site
claude4: Summary: [Transnational / Cross-border, Local / Site-specific] Global company transforms Mexican factory into zero water site, benefiting local water supply.
claude4: Rationale: The company's global initiative directly transformed a specific local factory in Mexico. The water savings benefit the immediate surrounding area with 6400 people.
gpt5: Scale Explanations: Transnational / Cross-border: “company’s first ‘zero water’ manufacturing site in the world” implies a company-wide global action.; Local / Site-specific: “a dairy factory in Mexico” and “surrounding area” are site-specific.

gpt5: Rationale: The company (global actor) explicitly transformed a specific factory (local), creating a cross-scale causal link. No national or regional actors are mentioned as causing or being affected.
4o: Rationale: The paragraph describes a local initiative with no explicit cross-scale interaction. The actions and effects are confined to the local scale of the factory and surrounding area.
gemini2.5: Rationale: The paragraph describes a 'zero water' manufacturing site (Local) saving water for people in the 'surrounding area' (Local). Both the actor (factory) and the impacted entity (surrounding area) are at the Local / Site-specific scale, thus no cross-scale interaction is present.

Full Paragraph Text: The new technology used at the factory in Jalisco, Mexico, heats milk at low pressure to remove some of the water. The resulting steam is then condensed and treated and used to clean machines. It is then recycled and used again. The process reduces by 15% the total amount of water used by Nestlé Mexico. Work is now underway to deploy similar tech nology in five other manufacturing sites in water stressed are as around the world. It is just one of a number of water-saving initiatives we have introduced in recent years, allowing us to reduce total water withdrawal in absolute terms by almost one third in the last decade.

claude4: Final Link: Local / Site-specific -> National, Local / Site-specific -> Transnational / Cross-border

claude4: Summary: [Local / Site-specific, National, Transnational / Cross-border] Factory technology influences national operations and global deployment
claude4: Rationale: The Jalisco factory's water-saving technology explicitly causes impacts at both national level (15% reduction for Nestlé Mexico) and global level (deployment to five sites worldwide). These are direct causal relationships from local innovation to broader scales.

Full Paragraph Text: The Maggi company began selling powdered soups in Switzerland in 1885. Julius Maggi had pioneered the production of pea and bean soups at the request of the Swiss Public Welfare Society to address the dietary deficiency of the work ing population. The advent of factory work for women meant less time to prepare food, and the soups were a convenient and nourishing alternative.

gpt5: Rationale: The national Swiss Public Welfare Society explicitly prompted a local producer. The resulting product explicitly targeted and benefited the national working population; no other scales are stated.

Full Paragraph Text: Parents want their children to make the most of their potential. Nestlé Milo, which is mainly consumed by children aged 7–12, can help to provide the nourishing energy they need to succeed. Activ-Go plays a role in energy release, muscle function, bone maintenance and red blood cell formation, all essential for physical activity.
claude4: Rationale: This paragraph discusses a commercial product (Nestlé Milo) and its nutritional benefits for children, but contains no actors operating at different spatial scales or any geographical cross-scale interactions. The content is purely about product marketing and nutrition without spatial dimensions.

Full Paragraph Text: Nestlé Milo celebrated its 80th birthday in 2014. It was created by Nestlé engineer Thomas Mayne to help children who had poor diets get sufficient nutrition. He created Nestlé Milo from malt, milk and cocoa to give children the nutritious energy they need to get the best out of their day. It was launched at the Sydney Easter Show in 1934.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph describes historical product development and launch events but contains no causal interactions between different spatial scales. It mentions Sydney as a launch location but no cross-scale influences are described.
gpt5: Rationale: Only a local event (Sydney Easter Show) is mentioned; no explicit causal interaction with any higher-scale actor is stated.

gemini2.5: Rationale: The paragraph describes the creation and launch of a product but lacks explicit causal links between actors operating at different spatial scales. There are no instances where an actor at one scale explicitly influences or is influenced by an actor at another scale.

Full Paragraph Text: In 2014 Nestlé’s organic growth was 4.5%, composed of 2.3% real internal growth and 2.2% pricing. Sales were CHF 91.6 billion, down 0.6%, impacted by negative foreign exchange of –5.5%. Acquisitions, net of divestitures, added 0.4% to sales.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph presents only corporate financial metrics and performance data without identifying any spatially-defined actors or cross-scale causal relationships. Foreign exchange impacts are mentioned but no specific geographical actors or their interactions are described.
gpt5: Rationale: Only corporate financial metrics and FX effects on company sales are mentioned; no actors mapped to the defined geographic scales and no explicit cross-scale causal links.

While 'foreign exchange' and 'acquisitions' are mentioned, their interaction with Nestlé's sales does not explicitly involve different geographical scales as defined. Foreign exchange is a global market phenomenon, and Nestlé's overall sales are also global, making any interaction same-scale (Transnational). The scale of acquisitions is not specified, preventing the identification of a cross-scale link.

Full Paragraph Text: The Group’s trading operating profit was CHF 14.0 billion, representing a margin of 15.3%, up 10 basis points, and up 30 basis points in constant currencies. The cost of goods sold fell by 30 basis points as a percentage of sales, driven by product mix and pricing actions and savings created by Nestlé Continuous Excellence which more than offset increases in raw material costs. Distribution costs were up by 10 basis points. Total marketing and administration expenses rose by 10 basis points as we increased consumer facing marketing support for our brands.

It does not contain any explicit actors or actions with geographical relevance, nor any causal links between different spatial scales. The text is purely financial and operational, lacking any spatial dimension for cross-scale analysis.

Full Paragraph Text: The Group’s operating cash flow remained strong at CHF 14.7 billion.

Full Paragraph Text: In 2014 we delivered strong results in a soft trading environment, building on the good growth of past years. They demonstrate the intrinsic strengths of Nestlé: the commit ment of our people, our global footprint, the strength of our portfolio and the quality of our innovation. While delivering in the short term, we remain focused on our business long term, strengthening the foundations of future growth.

Full Paragraph Text: The Zone’s organic growth was supported by double-digit growth for Nescafé Dolce Gusto and strong performances in ambient dairy and petcare. In North America growth improved towards the end of the year while in Latin America good growth was helped by pricing, reflecting inflationary pressures.

Full Paragraph Text: Our performance in North America was affected by the frozen category. Projects are underway to reposition Lean Cuisine, Hot Pockets and Stouffers. They address all elements of the marketing mix, reflecting trends such as organic and ethnic, enhancing the brands’ relevance to consumers. We are taking the same approach in frozen pizza where our California Pizza Kitchen did well. In ice cream the super premium segment performed well with Gelato, and snacks returned to growth, although the premium segment was subdued. In confectionery the successful roll-out of Butterfinger Peanut Butter Cups continued. Innovations like Natural Bliss and seasonal renovations of flavours helped Coffee-mate de liver good growth. Innovation also ensured the petcare busi ness in North America continued to grow with Dog Chow, Pro Plan and Tidy Cats Lightweight cat litter as highlights. The launch of Beyond natural pet food gained momentum.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph describes business performance and product repositioning activities within North America only, with no actors or actions at different spatial scales interacting causally. All mentioned activities occur at the same sub-national/regional scale.

4o: Rationale: The paragraph discusses business performance and strategies within North America without explicit cross-scale interactions involving different geographical scales.

Full Paragraph Text: Latin America delivered good organic growth despite a worsening of the macroeconomic situation towards the end of the year. Although consumer sentiment varied across the region, most markets did well. All Brazil’s categories grew, with Ninho in growing-up milks, KitKat in confectionery, Nesfit in biscuits and Nescau in cocoa and malt beverages making strong contributions. In Mexico the changes in fiscal legislation, pricing and subdued consumer demand affect ed the market. Nescafé Dolce Gusto delivered double-digit growth across the region, while Dog Chow and Pro Plan drove sales in the petcare business.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph describes business performance across different geographical markets (Latin America, Brazil, Mexico) but contains no explicit causal interactions between actors at different spatial scales. Full Paragraph Text: Relative to the market this was good growth, driven by innovation and premiumisation. Full Paragraph Text: Good performances in France, Switzerland, Austria and the Netherlands, and a recovery in Spain and Portugal sup ported the growth in Western Europe. The Great Britain region, Germany, Italy and Greece were more challenged. There were strong performances from petcare and Nescafé Dolce Gusto across Western Europe and we saw good growth from innovations in several categories. Highlights included Nescafé Gold and Azzera premium soluble coffee, Fresh Up and Buitoni Fiesta in frozen pizza, Maggi snacking noodles in ambient culinary and the launch of premium chocolate tablets Les Recettes de l’Atelier in France.

Full Paragraph Text: In Central and Eastern Europe, Russia and Ukraine drove the growth in a deteriorating economic environment. The ongoing roll-out of Papyrus cooking papers in ambient culinary also continued to do well.

Full Paragraph Text: The slower growth in the Zone was due to our largest market China and to Oceania. In China we needed to adapt our portfolio to reconnect with the fast-changing expectations of the Chinese consumer. Therefore, in addition to correcting trade stocks throughout the year, we focused on innovation, on reformulation and on re-launches, particularly in coffee, ready-to-drink and confectionery. We continued to see good performances in ambient culinary, ice cream and ready-to drink coffee. In Oceania we are focused on developing new trade channels.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph describes business performance and strategy adjustments in China and Oceania, but lacks explicit causal relationships between different spatial scales. All actions are contained within their respective national/regional contexts without cross-scale influence.

Full Paragraph Text: Strong growth continued in most other emerging markets, in particular the Philippines, South Asia, the Indochina region, Turkey and many markets in Africa. Maggi created a new breakfast option for the Indian market, Maggi Oats Noodles, and Nestlé Milo Activ-Go was launched in parts of South East Asia. It was also rolled out in Africa, helping to deliver good growth across the continent.

Full Paragraph Text: Nestlé Waters delivered solid broad-based organic and real internal growth in all three geographies. Nestlé Pure Life continued to be a growth engine, particularly in the emerging markets but also in North America and the United Kingdom. Perrier and S.Pellegrino, our premium international brands, continued to demonstrate our ability to create value in the category. Complementing these performances, strong local brands also delivered good growth, especially Buxton in the United Kingdom, Erikli in Turkey, La Vie in Vietnam and Yunnan Shan Quan in China.

Full Paragraph Text: The MuCell® Technology for Extrusion Blow Moulding was created in partnership with two packaging suppliers – ALPLA and MuCell Extrusion. Full Paragraph Text: Tough economic and financial headwinds with continued competitive intensity made 2014 one of the most challenging years that the industry and Unilever have faced for some time. A slowdown in the growth of emerging markets proved a testing environment while consumers in developed markets continued to show caution. Volatile currencies were a further negative.

It presents correlational observations about emerging markets, developed markets, and Unilever's performance without establishing direct cross-scale influences.

The influences mentioned are either within the same broad scale (e.g., global market conditions affecting a global company) or are conditions rather than actions of specific actors across scales.

Full Paragraph Text: However, Unilever’s business model and strategy proved robust, delivering a competitive performance with underlying sales growth ahead of the market and solid margin expansion. Our growth model is based on a leaner, more agile Unilever and consistency of delivery in this more volatile market is key. The Boards remain convinced that a clear, purpose-driven business model is the best way for Unilever to continue generating sustainable, long-term returns for all stakeholders, including our shareholders, as proved by a year of strong, dependable cash flow and steadily increasing dividends. The full year dividend paid in 2014 rose to €1.12, a 7% increase on 2013.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph discusses Unilever's corporate performance, business model, and financial metrics without identifying specific spatial actors or cross-scale geographical interactions. All content relates to general business strategy rather than spatially-defined entities.
gpt5: Rationale: The paragraph describes corporate performance and dividends without any geographic actors or cross-scale causal effects. No explicit interaction between different spatial scales is stated.

gemini2.5: Rationale: The paragraph describes Unilever's internal business performance and strategy. It does not mention any specific geographical locations or explicit causal interactions between different spatial scales.

Full Paragraph Text: Investing in people and in innovation is crucial in this tough environment. To that end, the Boards were pleased to spend time at Unilever’s new state-of-the-art training facility in Singapore, and to see first-hand the high-quality innovations being developed for the Refreshment category at Unilever’s global R&D laboratory in Colworth, UK.

However, the actions described ('spent time at', 'to see first-hand') do not explicitly state a causal influence or being influenced between these different spatial scales. The interactions are observational, not causal.

Full Paragraph Text: The volatile currency environment made our review of the Group’s treasury operations particularly pertinent. Full Paragraph Text: We undertook major launches of brands including Lifebuoy into China and Omo into Saudi Arabia and the Gulf region. Brazil saw the entry of the Baby Dove range and Omo stain removers.

Full Paragraph Text: In China we undertook large capital expenditure, building a new dry savoury plant and a new washing powder factory. In Indonesia, large-scale capital investment was made in Siliwangi, creating a plant for Cikarang Foods, adding significant capacity to dry and wet savoury production. In the Philippines a new dry savoury factory was built. Detergent and ice cream factories were built in Africa.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph describes parallel industrial investments across different countries (China, Indonesia, Philippines, Africa) but contains no explicit causal relationships between these locations. Each investment appears to be independent with no stated cross-scale influences.
gpt5: Scale Explanations: Transnational / Cross-border: A firm (“we”) invests across multiple countries (China, Indonesia, Philippines, Africa).; Local / Site-specific: Concrete plants/factories are built at specific sites (dry savoury plants, Siliwangi plant, detergent/ice cream factories).
gpt5: Summary: [Transnational / Cross-border, Local / Site-specific] A transnational firm’s investments built local plants in China, Indonesia (Siliwangi), the Philippines, and Africa.
gpt5: Rationale: The text explicitly links the company’s cross-border capital expenditure to the construction of specific local factories. No national or regional authorities act causally, so only this cross-scale link is included.
4o: Rationale: The paragraph describes local investments in various countries without explicit cross-scale interactions between different spatial scales.
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: National: Refers to 'Indonesia' and 'large-scale capital investment' made within the country.; Local / Site-specific: Refers to 'Siliwangi' and 'Cikarang Foods' plant, which are specific facilities/locations.
gemini2.5: Summary: [National, Local / Site-specific] National-level capital investment in Indonesia led to the creation of a local plant in Siliwangi.
gemini2.5: Rationale: The paragraph explicitly states that 'large-scale capital investment was made in Indonesia', which is a national-level action. This investment causally led to 'creating a plant for Cikarang Foods' in 'Siliwangi', which are local-level entities. Other mentions of factory building lack explicit cross-scale causal actors.

Full Paragraph Text: We are extending our distribution reach in the outer islands of Indonesia, rural India and the north and central west of Brazil, while Singapore continues to be a major hub for our development of Unilever people at our Four Acres training campus.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph describes parallel business activities across different locations without establishing explicit causal relationships between scales. Distribution expansion and training operations are presented as separate initiatives rather than one influencing the other.
gpt5: Scales: Local / Site-specific, Sub-national / Regional, Transnational / Cross-border
gpt5: Links: Transnational / Cross-border -> Sub-national / Regional | Local / Site-specific -> Transnational / Cross-border
gpt5: Final Link: Transnational / Cross-border -> Sub-national / Regional, Local / Site-specific -> Transnational / Cross-border
gpt5: Scale Explanations: Local / Site-specific: Four Acres training campus in Singapore is a specific facility.; Sub-national / Regional: Outer islands of Indonesia, rural India, and north/central west Brazil are within-country regions.; Transnational / Cross-border: Unilever (“we”) operates across multiple countries.
gpt5: Summary: [Local / Site-specific, Sub-national / Regional, Transnational / Cross-border] Unilever expands distribution in regional areas and uses a Singapore campus as a hub to develop its global workforce.
gpt5: Rationale: A multinational actor explicitly expands operations in named sub-national regions. The Singapore Four Acres site explicitly serves as a hub for company-wide (transnational) people development.
4o: Rationale: The paragraph describes distribution and training activities in various locations but does not establish any explicit cross-scale causal interactions between different spatial scales.
gemini2.5: Links: Transnational -> Sub-national / Regional | Transnational -> Local / Site-specific
gemini2.5: Final Link: Transnational -> Sub-national / Regional, Transnational -> Local / Site-specific

gemini2.5: Summary: [Transnational, Sub-national / Regional, Local / Site-specific] Unilever's transnational operations extend distribution to sub-national regions and conduct training at a local campus.
gemini2.5: Rationale: The paragraph describes Unilever's (Transnational) influence on Sub-national/Regional areas through distribution and on a Local/Site-specific campus for training. The National scale (Singapore) was excluded to meet the three-scale limit, focusing on the most direct causal links.

Full Paragraph Text: Operating in an environment of almost unprecedented volatility and complexity will remain a big challenge for everyone. Few people predicted that in 2014 we would see such a sharp slowdown in some of the major world economies or the escalation of geopolitical conflicts or the outbreak of pandemics like Ebola and oil prices ending the year at less than US $50 a barrel. We must be prepared for a similarly unpredictable year in 2015.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph describes global trends and events (economic slowdowns, geopolitical conflicts, pandemics, oil prices) but does not identify specific actors at different spatial scales or establish explicit causal relationships between actors across scales. It presents observations about volatility without detailing how actors at one scale influence those at another.
gpt5: Rationale: The paragraph lists global phenomena (economies, conflicts, pandemics, oil prices) but states no explicit causal influence between different spatial scales.
4o: Rationale: The paragraph discusses global events and challenges but does not specify any cross-scale causal interactions between actors at different spatial scales.
gemini2.5: Rationale: The paragraph describes several events (slowdown in world economies, geopolitical conflicts, Ebola outbreak, oil prices) that are all implicitly at a Transnational / Cross-border scale. It does not establish any explicit causal links between actors operating at different spatial scales.

Full Paragraph Text: The key is to have a model that responds to people’s needs and concerns, and an organisation that is both resilient and agile in the face of growing economic and geopolitical uncertainty. We achieved that again in 2014 and I want to thank – and recognise – the supreme efforts of our 172,000 colleagues and the many more partners around the world.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph discusses organizational principles and acknowledges global workforce but contains no explicit causal interactions between different spatial scales. References to 'around the world' and 'geopolitical uncertainty' are descriptive context rather than actionable cross-scale relationships.
gpt5: Rationale: No explicit causal link between actors at different geographic scales is stated; the organization and ‘partners around the world’ are not tied to defined scales nor to cross-scale causality.
4o: Rationale: The paragraph lacks explicit cross-scale causal interactions between defined spatial scales. It discusses organizational resilience without specific geographical actors or actions.
gemini2.5: Rationale: The paragraph mentions 'partners around the world' indicating a global scope, but it does not describe any explicit causal interaction between actors at different spatial scales. There are no clear 'actor at Scale X influences actor at Scale Y' statements.

Full Paragraph Text: We expect the economic pressures to continue. Consumer demand in emerging markets is likely to remain subdued for some time to come. There is still little sign of a recovery in Europe and, while conditions in North America have improved, any increase in consumer demand is likely to be slow and shoppers will remain focused on value.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph describes economic conditions and consumer demand patterns across different regions (emerging markets, Europe, North America) but presents them as parallel observations without any explicit causal interactions between scales. No actors at one scale are shown to influence or be influenced by actors at another scale.
gpt5: Rationale: The paragraph describes regional macroeconomic conditions (Europe, North America, emerging markets) without stating any explicit causal influence across different spatial scales or actors.
4o: Rationale: The paragraph discusses economic conditions without identifying specific actors or explicit cross-scale causal interactions.
gemini2.5: Rationale: The paragraph describes economic conditions in different transnational regions (emerging markets, Europe, North America) but does not establish any explicit causal links between these or any other spatial scales. All mentioned regions are at the same 'Transnational / Cross-border' scale, and no interactions are described between them or with other scales.

Full Paragraph Text: We are also prepared for managing any continuing volatility on the world’s currency markets and for what could be fluctuations in commodity costs as a result of the reduction in oil prices. At the same time, we expect the levels of competitive activity – both from global competitors and, increasingly, from local players – to remain high in 2015.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph discusses global market conditions and competitive dynamics but lacks concrete actors at specific spatial scales taking actions that causally influence actors at other scales. It presents general market observations without explicit cross-scale causal relationships.
gpt5: Rationale: Only global-to-global causality (oil prices -> commodity costs) and non-causal mention of global vs. local competitors; no explicit cross-scale causal link.
4o: Rationale: The paragraph discusses global and local economic conditions but lacks explicit causal links between actors at different spatial scales.
gemini2.5: Rationale: The paragraph identifies global and local factors (world's currency markets, global competitors, local players) but does not explicitly state a causal influence or interaction between actors at different spatial scales. It lists them as separate sources of volatility or competition.

Full Paragraph Text: Despite these pressures, we are confident that with the many positive changes we have already made to Unilever we are well placed to continue delivering our objectives of volume growth ahead of our markets, steady and sustainable improvements in core operating margin, and strong cash flow.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph discusses Unilever's internal business objectives and performance metrics without identifying any specific spatial actors or cross-scale geographical interactions. No concrete spatial scales or causal relationships between different geographical levels are mentioned.
gpt5: Rationale: No explicit geographic actors or cross-scale causal effects are mentioned; the text discusses corporate performance broadly without spatial references.
4o: Rationale: The paragraph discusses Unilever's internal objectives without mentioning any cross-scale interactions or actors at different spatial scales.
gemini2.5: Rationale: The paragraph focuses on Unilever's internal performance and objectives. While Unilever is a transnational actor, there are no explicit causal links identified between Unilever (or any other actor) and an actor at a different spatial scale. 'Our markets' refers to a performance benchmark, not an interacting spatial entity.

Full Paragraph Text: Even though we have made significant strides over recent years in improving our organisational agility and our ability to respond quickly to events, there is still room for improvement. I would like to have seen us react a little quicker, for example, to the slowdown in a number of markets, particularly China, where frankly we were caught off-guard by the speed and scale of weakening consumer demand. In terms of our categories, all of them contributed – albeit in different ways – to the overall performance of the Group and I have confidence in the strength and long-term growth potential of our portfolio.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph discusses organizational responses to market conditions in China but lacks explicit causal interactions between different spatial scales. China is mentioned as a market context rather than as an actor influencing or being influenced by actors at other scales.
gpt5: Scale Explanations: National: Mentions China as a country market with weakening consumer demand.; Transnational / Cross-border: Refers to a multinational Group operating across markets.
gpt5: Summary: [National, Transnational / Cross-border] China's weakening consumer demand caught the multinational Group off-guard, influencing its performance and response.
gpt5: Rationale: The text explicitly ties China's demand slowdown to the Group being caught off-guard, indicating national-to-transnational causality. No other concrete local or regional actors are specified.
4o: Rationale: The paragraph discusses organizational agility and market reactions without explicit cross-scale interactions involving geographical actors.

Full Paragraph Text: We took steps last year to sharpen the portfolio even further with a number of strategic acquisitions and disposal of non-core brands, although there is always scope to do more and I would like to see the level of activity accelerate in the year ahead. It is also clear that we still need to do more to get our Foods category growing again, although we are winning market share.
